refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The functions in this section provide some shortcuts to finding certain file paths. There are also some functions for manipulating environment variables for those systems that do not have getenv() and similar functions.

note.para: Many of the function in here are now deprecated in favour of similar functions in glib. The preferred replacement function in those cases is indicated below.

refsect2.title: gnome_is_program_in_path()

warning.para: gnome_is_program_in_path is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deprecated, use g_find_program_in_path

listitem.simpara: A program name.
NULL if program is not on the path or a string allocated with g_malloc() with the full path name of the program found.

refsect2.title: g_extension_pointer ()
refsect2.para: Extracts the extension from the end of a filename (the part after the final '.' in the filename).

listitem.simpara: A filename or file path.
A pointer to the extension part of the filename, or a pointer to the end of the string if the filename does not have an extension.

refsect2.title: gnome_util_prepend_user_home()
refsect2.para: Prepends the home directory of the user to a filename.

listitem.simpara: A relative filename in the user's home directory.
A string containing x with the user's home directory path prepended. The string should be freed with g_free() when no longer required.

refsect2.title: gnome_util_home_file()
refsect2.para: Similar to gnome_util_prepend_user_home(), except that "/home/fred/.gnome2", instead of just "/home/fred/" is put on the front.

listitem.simpara: A filename relative to the user's .gnome2 directory. Returns: A string containing afile with the user's home directory path and "/.gnome2" prepended. The string should be freed with g_free() when no longer required.

refsect2.title: gnome_util_user_shell ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the user's preferred shell.

listitem.simpara: A newly allocated string that is the path to the shell.

refsect2.title: gnome_setenv ()
refsect2.para: Adds "name=value" to the environment. Note that on systems without setenv, this leaks memory so please do not use inside a loop or anything like that. The semantics are the same as the glibc setenv() (if setenv() exists, it is used).
If overwrite is FALSE and the variable already exists in the environment, then 0 is returned and the value is not changed.

listitem.simpara: An environment variable name.
The value to assign to the environment variable.
If TRUE, overwrite the existing name variable in the environment.
0 on success, -1 on error

refsect2.title: gnome_unsetenv ()
refsect2.para: Removes name from the environment. In case there is no native implementation of unsetenv, this could cause leaks depending on the implementation of environment.

listitem.simpara: The environment variable to unset.

refsect2.title: gnome_clearenv ()
refsect2.para: Clears out the environment completely. In case there is no native implementation of clearenv, this could cause leaks depending on the implementation of environment.

refsect2.title: g_concat_dir_and_file()

warning.para: g_concat_dir_and_file is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Programs should use g_build_filename() instead of this function.

listitem.simpara: Directory name.
Filename.
A newly allocated string that is the concatenation of dir and file, with seperators appropriate for the filesystem automatically taken care of.

refsect2.title: g_file_exists()

warning.para: g_file_exists is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Programs should use g_file_test(filename, G_FILE_TEST_EXISTS) instead of this function.

listitem.simpara: Filename.
Returns TRUE if filename exists, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_unix_error_string()

warning.para: g_unix_error_string is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Programs should use g_strerror() instead of this function. Also, note that the returned string is only valid until the next call to g_strerror() or g_unix_error_string().

listitem.simpara: A system error number (see C errno documentation for more info).
A string describing the error code.

refsect2.title: gnome_util_user_home()

warning.para: gnome_util_user_home is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Programs should use g_get_home_dir() instead of this function.

refsect2.title: g_copy_vector()

warning.para: g_copy_vector is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Use g_strdupv() instead of this function.

listitem.simpara: An array of strings. NULL terminated.
A copy of the NULL-terminated string array.
